title: scilus/nf-pediatric pipeline parameters
description: nf-pediatric is a neuroimaging pipeline to process pediatric MRI data (dMRI, and sMRI) ranging from 0-18 years old.

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: This section will detail how to set the inputs and outputs of the pipeline.

input.description: Path to the BIDS directory location.
input.help_text: Ensure the BIDS data structure is respected. For more information, see the [documentation](https://scilus.github.io/nf-pediatric/guides/inputs/)

participant_label.description: List of participant IDs or a single participant ID.
participant_label.help_text: This will be used to select the specific participants to process. The best way to provide them is in a params.yml file, see the [documentation](https://scilus.github.io/nf-pediatric/guides/usage/#using-the-paramsyml-file) for more information.

input_deriv.description: Path to the derivatives directory to use as input.

bids_script.help_text: This is a script that will be used to generate the BIDS directory structure from the raw data. Unless you know what you are doing, this should not be changed. Will be removed in a future release.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.
outdir.help_text: For a detailed description of the output files, please see the [documentation](https://scilus.github.io/nf-pediatric/guides/outputs/).

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title_subject.description: MultiQC report title for subject report. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

multiqc_title_global.description: MultiQC report title for global report. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

freesurfer_options.title: Segmentation Options
freesurfer_options.description: Options for FreeSurfer, FastSurfer, and/or M-CRIB-S processing. Only relevant if you select the segmentation profile.
freesurfer_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the FreeSurfer, FastSurfer and/or M-CRIB-S processing steps in the pipeline.

method.description: Method to use to perform surface reconstruction and cortical/subcortical segmentation. Will only affect subjects > 3 months of age. Recon-all-clinical is highly recommended for subjects between 3 months and 5 years old. Options include recon-all, recon-all-clinical, or FastSurfer.
method.errorMessage: Invalid method. Must be one of: recon-all-clinical, recon-all, fastsurfer.

fs_license.help_text: This is required to run the segmentation profile. You can obtain a FreeSurfer license from the [FreeSurfer website here](https://surfer.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu/registration.html).

cerebnet.description: Use CerebNet for cerebellum segmentation in FastSurfer.

hypvinn.description: Use HypVINN for hypothalamus sub-segmentation in FastSurfer.

fs_output_dir.help_text: Default location will be alongside `--outdir`. For more information, please see the [documentation](https://scilus.github.io/nf-pediatric/guides/outputs/)

mcribs_jointhresh.description: Join threshold used in the MCRIBS surface reconstruction step.

mcribs_fastcollision.description: Use deformable fast collision test in the MCRIBS surface reconstruction step.

mcribs_nopialoutside.description: Do not ensure pial is outside of WM in the MCRIBS surface reconstruction step.

mcribs_seed.description: Seed used in the MCRIBS surface reconstruction step.

atlases_options.title: Atlases Options
atlases_options.description: Options for atlases used in the pipeline.
atlases_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the atlases used in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the atlases.

utils_folder.help_text: This folder contains the atlases used in the pipeline. Unless you know what you are doing, please do not change this.

anat_processing_steps.title: Processing steps to apply on anatomical images.
anat_processing_steps.description: Processing steps to apply on anatomical images. (NOTE: the same steps will be applied on both T1w/T2w if both are available).
anat_processing_steps.help_text: These options are used to configure the processing steps to apply on anatomical images. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the processing steps.

preproc_run_denoising.description: Run denoising on the anatomical images.

preproc_run_N4.description: Run N4 bias correction on the anatomical images.

preproc_run_resampling.description: Run resampling on the anatomical images.

preproc_run_ants_bet.help_text: This step will require the use of a template image which does not match all ages and is much slower than the default synthstrip method. Not recommended.

preproc_run_crop.description: Run cropping on the anatomical images.

synthstrip_weights.description: Path to alternative weights for SynthStrip brain extraction.

t1_processing_options.title: T1w Processing Options
t1_processing_options.description: Options for T1w processing. In the case where you do not have a T1w image, you can ignore those options.
t1_processing_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the T1w processing steps in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the T1w processing steps.

t1_denoise_number_of_coils.description: Number of coils used in the T1w denoising step.

t1_bias_bspline_knot_per_voxel.description: Number of B-spline knots per voxel used in the T1w bias correction step.

t1_bias_shrink_factor.description: Shrink factor used in the T1w bias correction step.

t1_resample_voxel_size.description: Voxel size used in the T1w resampling step.

t1_resample_interp.description: Interpolation method used in the T1w resampling step.

t1_synthstrip_border.description: Mask border threshold used in the SynthStrip brain extraction step.

t1_synthstrip_nocsf.description: Exclude CSF from the border in the SynthStrip brain extraction step.

t2_preprocessing_options.title: T2w Preprocessing Options
t2_preprocessing_options.description: Options for T2w preprocessing. In the case where you do not have a T2w image, you can ignore those options.
t2_preprocessing_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the T2w preprocessing steps in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the T2w preprocessing steps.

t2_denoise_number_of_coils.description: Number of coils used in the T2w denoising step.

t2_bias_bspline_knot_per_voxel.description: Number of B-spline knots per voxel used in the T2w bias correction step.

t2_bias_shrink_factor.description: Shrink factor used in the T2w bias correction step.

t2_resample_voxel_size.description: Voxel size used in the T2w resampling step.

t2_resample_interp.description: Interpolation method used in the T2w resampling step.

t2_synthstrip_border.description: Mask border threshold used in the SynthStrip brain extraction step.

t2_synthstrip_nocsf.description: Exclude CSF from the border in the SynthStrip brain extraction step.

coreg_options.title: Anatomical Co-registration Options
coreg_options.description: Options for anatomical co-registration. Will only be performed if both T2w and T1w images are available.
coreg_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the anatomical co-registration steps in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the anatomical co-registration steps.

coreg_transform.description: Transform used in the coregistration step. t: translation (1 stage), r: rigid (1 stage), a: rigid + affine (2 stages), s: rigid + affine + deformable syn (3 stages)
coreg_transform.errorMessage: Invalid method. Must be one of: t, r, a, or s.

coreg_quick.description: Use antsRegistrationSyNQuick for the coregistration step.

dwi_preprocessing_options.title: DWI Preprocessing Options
dwi_preprocessing_options.description: Options for DWI preprocessing. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the DWI preprocessing steps.
dwi_preprocessing_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the DWI preprocessing steps in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the DWI preprocessing steps.

dwi_b0_threshold.description: B0 threshold used in the DWI preprocessing steps.

dwi_shell_tolerance.description: Shell tolerance used in the DWI preprocessing steps.

preproc_dwi_run_denoising.description: Run denoising on the DWI images.

dwi_denoise_patch_size.description: Patch size used in the DWI denoising step.

preproc_dwi_run_degibbs.description: Run Gibbs ringing correction on the DWI images.

topup_eddy_run_topup.description: Run topup in the susceptibility distortion correction step.

dwi_susceptibility_config_file.description: Path to the susceptibility distortion correction config file.

dwi_susceptibility_output_prefix.description: Prefix used in the susceptibility distortion correction step.

dwi_susceptibility_readout.description: Readout time used in the susceptibility distortion correction step.

dwi_susceptibility_encoding_dir.description: Encoding direction used in the susceptibility distortion correction step.

topup_eddy_run_eddy.description: Run eddy in the eddy current correction step.

dwi_motion_and_eddy_command.description: Command used in the motion and eddy correction step.

dwi_motion_and_eddy_bet_f_threshold.description: Bet f threshold used in the motion and eddy correction step.

dwi_motion_and_eddy_restore_slices.description: Restore slices in the motion and eddy correction step.

dwi_pwdavg_shells.description: Shells used in the PowderAverage step.

dwi_synthstrip_border.description: Brain border used in the SynthStrip brain extraction step.

dwi_synthstrip_nocsf.description: Exclude CSF from the border in the SynthStrip brain extraction step.

dwi_synthstrip_weights.description: Alternative weights used in the SynthStrip brain extraction step.

dwi_bet_f_threshold.description: Bet f threshold used in the brain extraction step.

preproc_dwi_run_N4.description: Run N4 bias correction on the DWI images.

dwi_bias_bspline_knot_per_voxel.description: Number of B-spline knots per voxel used in the DWI bias correction step.

dwi_bias_shrink_factor.description: Shrink factor used in the DWI bias correction step.

dwi_normalize_fa_mask_threshold.description: FA mask threshold used in the normalization step.

preproc_dwi_run_resampling.description: Run resampling on the DWI images.

dwi_resample_voxel_size.description: Voxel size used in the DWI resampling step.

dwi_resample_interp.description: Interpolation method used in the DWI resampling step.

dwi_resample_mask_voxel_size.description: Voxel size used in the DWI mask resampling step.

dwi_resample_mask_interp.description: Interpolation method used in the DWI mask resampling step.

dti_options.title: DTI Options
dti_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the DTI processing steps in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the DTI processing steps.

dti_max_shell_value.description: Maximum shell value used in the DTI processing step.

dti_shells.description: Shells used in the DTI processing step.

frf_options.title: FRF Options
frf_options.description: Options for fiber response function (FRF) processing. The FRF is derived from normative curves in function of each participant's age. The current options are mostly if you want to override this default behavior.
frf_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the FRF processing steps in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the FRF processing steps.

frf_fa.description: Minimum FA threshold to use to compute the FRF.

frf_min_fa.description: Minimum FA threshold to use to compute the FRF.

frf_nvox_min.description: Minimum number of voxels to include in the computation of the FRF.

frf_roi_radius.description: Radius of the ROI used to compute the FRF.

frf_set_method.description: Method used to compute the FRF.
frf_set_method.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be 'ssst', 'msmt' will come in future releases.

frf_manual_frf.description: Manual FRF values.(e.g. '15,4,4'). This is set from the normative curves. Use this option only to apply a single FRF to every participants.

fodf_options.title: FODF Options
fodf_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the FODF processing steps in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the FODF processing steps.

fodf_shells.description: Shells used in the FODF processing step.

fodf_sh_order.description: Spherical harmonics order used in the FODF processing step.

fodf_sh_basis.description: Spherical harmonics basis used in the FODF processing step. Choices: descoteaux07 or tournier07.
fodf_sh_basis.errorMessage: Invalid basis. Must be either 'descoteaux07' or 'tournier07'.

fodf_set_method.description: Method used to compute the FODF.
fodf_set_method.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be 'ssst', 'msmt' will come in future releases.

fodf_relative_threshold.description: Relative threshold used in the FODF processing step.

fodf_a_factor.description: FODF a factor used in the FODF processing step.

fodf_max_fa_threshold.description: Maximum FA threshold used in the FODF processing step.

fodf_min_md_threshold.description: Minimum MD threshold used in the FODF processing step.

pft_tracking_options.title: PFT Tracking Options
pft_tracking_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the PFT tracking steps in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the PFT tracking steps.

pft_seeding_mask_type.description: Seeding mask type used in the PFT tracking step. Choices: wm, fa, or interface.
pft_seeding_mask_type.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be either 'wm', 'fa', or 'interface'.

pft_fa_threshold.description: FA threshold to use on FA map to generate seeding mask.

pft_random_seed.description: Random seed used in the PFT tracking step.

pft_compress_value.description: Compression value for the streamlines' compression.

pft_algo.description: Algorithm used in the PFT tracking step. Choices: prob or det
pft_algo.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be either 'prob' or 'det'.

pft_nbr_seeds.description: Number of seeds used in the PFT tracking step.

pft_seeding_type.description: Seeding type used in the PFT tracking step. Choices: npv or nt.
pft_seeding_type.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be either 'npv' or 'nt'.

pft_step.description: Step value used in the PFT tracking step.

pft_theta.description: Theta value used in the PFT tracking step.

pft_sfthres.description: SF threshold used in the PFT tracking step.

pft_sfthres_init.description: Initial SF threshold used in the PFT tracking step.

pft_min_len.description: Minimum length used in the PFT tracking step.

pft_max_len.description: Maximum length used in the PFT tracking step.

pft_particles.description: Number of particles used in the PFT tracking step.

local_tracking_options.title: Local Tracking Options
local_tracking_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the local tracking steps in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the local tracking steps.

local_seeding_mask_type.description: Seeding mask type used in the local tracking step.
local_seeding_mask_type.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be either 'wm', 'fa', or 'interface'.

local_fa_tracking_mask_threshold.description: FA threshold used for the tracking mask.

local_fa_seeding_mask_threshold.description: FA threshold used for the seeding mask.

local_tracking_mask_type.description: Tracking mask type used in the local tracking step. Choices: wm, fa, or interface.
local_tracking_mask_type.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be either 'wm', 'fa' or 'interface'.

local_random_seed.description: Random seed used in the local tracking step.

local_compress_value.description: Compression value for the streamlines' compression.

local_algo.description: Algorithm used in the local tracking step. Choices: prob or det
local_algo.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be either 'prob' or 'det'.

local_nbr_seeds.description: Number of seeds used in the local tracking step.

local_seeding_type.description: Seeding type used in the local tracking step. Choices: npv or nt.
local_seeding_type.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be either 'npv' or 'nt'.

local_step.description: Step value used in the local tracking step.

local_theta.description: Theta value used in the local tracking step.

local_sfthres.description: SF threshold used in the local tracking step.

local_min_len.description: Minimum length used in the local tracking step.

local_max_len.description: Maximum length used in the local tracking step.

bundleseg_options.title: BundleSeg Options
bundleseg_options.help_text: These options are used to configure how BundleSeg will recognize and extract bundles from the whole-brain tractogram.

minimal_vote_ratio.description: Ratio of vote across models to consider a streamline for saving. If you have 5 input models and a ratio of 0.5, you will need at least 3 votes.

outlier_alpha.description: Percentage of the length of the tree that clusters of individual streamlines will be pruned. Higher values will remove more streamlines.

nb_points.description: Number of points to segment the bundles.

colormap.description: Colormap to use for coloring the bundles. Color only affects visualization.

density_weighting.description: If set, weight statistics based on the number of voxel going through the voxel.

normalize_weights.description: If set, the weights will be normalized to the [0,1] range.

length_stats.description: If set, will output bundles' length.

endpoints_stats.description: If set, will output statistics in endpoints.

means_std.description: If set, will output mean and std values per bundle per metrics.

volume.description: If set, will output volume values per bundle.

streamline_count.description: If set, will output the streamline count per bundle.

volume_per_labels.description: If set, will output volume values per labels per bundle.

mean_std_per_point.description: If set, will output mean and std per points per metrics per bundle.

transform_labels_options.title: Transform Labels Options
transform_labels_options.description: Options for transforming labels from anatomical to diffusion space.
transform_labels_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the transformation of labels in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the label transformation steps.

labels_output_suffix.description: Name to use as suffix in the output filename.

labels_interpolation.description: Interpolation method used in the label transformation step. Choices: NearestNeighbor, Linear, or BSpline.
labels_interpolation.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be either 'NearestNeighbor', 'Linear', or 'BSpline'.

labels_output_dtype.description: Output data type used in the label transformation step. Choices: float or int.
labels_output_dtype.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be either 'float' or 'int'.

commit_options.title: COMMIT Options
commit_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the COMMIT filtering steps in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the COMMIT filtering steps.

commit2_lambda.description: Lambda value used in the COMMIT filtering step.

commit_para_diff.description: Para diff value used in the COMMIT filtering step.
commit_para_diff.help_text: This value is derived from normative curves in function of each participant's age. For more information, please see [the documentation](https://scilus.github.io/nf-pediatric/guides/priors/).

commit_iso_diff.description: Iso diff value used in the COMMIT filtering step.
commit_iso_diff.help_text: This value is derived from normative curves in function of each participant's age. For more information, please see [the documentation](https://scilus.github.io/nf-pediatric/guides/priors/).

commit_perp_diff.description: Perp diff value used in the COMMIT filtering step.
commit_perp_diff.help_text: This value is derived from normative curves in function of each participant's age. For more information, please see [the documentation](https://scilus.github.io/nf-pediatric/guides/priors/).

commit_ball_stick.description: Use the ball and stick model in the COMMIT filtering step.

commit_nbr_dir.description: Number of directions used in the COMMIT filtering step.

decompose_options.title: Decompose Tractogram Options
decompose_options.description: Options for decomposing the tractogram according to a label file.
decompose_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the decomposition of the tractogram in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the tractogram decomposition steps.

decompose_no_remove_loops.description: Do not remove loops from the tractogram.

decompose_no_remove_outliers.description: Do not remove outliers from the tractogram.

decompose_no_remove_curv.description: Do not remove curvilinear structures from the tractogram.

decompose_min_len.description: Minimum length used in the tractogram decomposition step.

decompose_max_len.description: Maximum length used in the tractogram decomposition step.

decompose_outlier_threshold.description: Outlier threshold used in the tractogram decomposition step.

decompose_max_angle.description: Maximum angle used in the tractogram decomposition step.

decompose_max_curv.description: Maximum curvature used in the tractogram decomposition step.

afd_fixel_options.title: AFD Fixel Options
afd_fixel_options.help_text: These options are used to configure the AFD fixel processing steps in the pipeline. You can use these options to customise the behaviour of the AFD fixel processing steps.

afd_fixel_length_weighting.description: Use length weighting in the AFD fixel processing step.

template.title: Output to Template Options
template.description: Options for outputting to specific template space.
template.help_text: These options are used to configure the output to template space steps in the pipeline (e.g., template selection, resolution, etc.).

template.description: Template space to output to. The available template are the ones supported by TemplateFlow, please see their documentation for an exhaustive list (https://www.templateflow.org/browse/).

templateflow_cohort.description: Cohort to use for the template space (not required for most template, but if it is, simply provide the cohort's number).

templateflow_home.description: Path to the TemplateFlow home directory where templates will be downloaded. If you are running the pipeline without internet access, this needs to point to a folder containing predownloaded templates.

use_template_t2w.description: Use the T2w image from the template space (useful with infant data.).

profiles.title: Pipeline profile
profiles.description: Pipeline profile options. This is a short list of options. For full description, please see [the documentation](https://scilus.github.io/nf-pediatric/guides/usage/#choosing-a-profile)

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.
publish_dir_mode.errorMessage: Invalid choice. Must be either 'symlink', 'rellink', 'link', 'copy', 'copyNoFollow', or 'move'.

lean_output.description: Do not copy intermediate files to output directory.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

multiqc_logo.description: Custom logo file to supply to MultiQC. File name must also be set in the MultiQC config file

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

pipelines_testdata_base_path.description: Base URL or local path to location of pipeline test dataset files

trace_report_suffix.description: Suffix to add to the trace report filename. Default is the date and time in the format yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss.
